snippet: After The New York Times reported about an Afghan man who had agreed to trade his daughter to resolve a debt, the father called The Times and said the debt had been paid nearly a month ago by an anonymous donor.
abstract: Taj Mohammad, refugee from fighting in Helmand Province, Afghanistan, who had agreed to give his 6-year-old daughter in marriage to pay off his debt to another man, which was reported in The New York Times, says that debt was paid by anonymous donor month before article was published.
lead_paragraph: After The New York Times reported about an Afghan man who had agreed to trade his daughter to resolve a debt, the father called The Times and said the debt had been paid nearly a month ago by an anonymous donor.

headline.seo: Donor Pays Afghan Family’s Debt, but Questions Remain
headline.main: Afghan Who Agreed to Trade His Daughter to End a Debt Says It Was Paid
headline.print_headline: Afghan Who Agreed to Trade His Daughter to End a Debt Says It Was Paid
